Document Sentiment Analysis

Objective

The Document Sentiment Analysis Application is a powerful tool for extracting and analyzing sentiment from text data in PDF or TXT files. It allows users to identify and understand emotional tones within their documents, providing:

  • Individual Sentiment Ratings: Positive, negative, or neutral scores for each row or section of the document.
  • Overall Sentiment Rating: A summary sentiment score for the entire document.


Steps to Use

  1. Load the Document: Upload the PDF or TXT file you want to analyze.
  2. Execute the Analysis: Click the "Execute" button to process the document and generate sentiment results.
  3. Review Results: View the detailed sentiment analysis, including per-section ratings and overall sentiment.


User Example

Sophie - A Customer Support Manager

  • About Sophie:
  • Sophie leads the customer support team at a SaaS company. She regularly reviews customer feedback reports to identify trends and address client concerns effectively.
  • Goals:
  • Sophie wants to:
  • Quickly identify negative feedback to prioritize issues.
  • Understand the overall customer sentiment to report to senior management.
  • Save time spent manually analyzing long documents.

Sophie’s Experience with the Sentiment Analysis Tool:

  • Uploading a Feedback Report:
  1. Sophie receives a 20-page PDF containing customer feedback collected over a month. Instead of reading through each page, she uploads the document to the application.
  • Processing the File:
  1. She clicks the "Execute" button, and within seconds, the application processes the document and presents the sentiment analysis.
  • Reviewing Results:
  1. The application highlights specific sections with high negative sentiment, such as recurring complaints about a software bug.
  2. It also shows areas with positive sentiment, such as praise for the quick response time of the support team.
  3. Sophie sees the overall sentiment score is slightly positive, which reassures her that most customers are satisfied.
  • Actionable Insights:
  1. With the sentiment analysis, Sophie prepares a report for the management team. She includes:
  • Recommendations to address critical issues.
  • Positive feedback as examples of customer satisfaction.
  • Outcome:
  1. Sophie saves hours of manual work and delivers data-driven insights, improving her team’s efficiency and the customer experience.


Who Can Benefit from This Application?

  • Customer Support Teams: Analyze customer feedback to identify areas for improvement.
  • HR Managers: Evaluate employee sentiment in surveys or open-text feedback.
  • Marketing Teams: Understand audience reactions to campaigns or social media content.
  • Researchers: Analyze sentiment in qualitative data from interviews or surveys.


Why Use the Document Sentiment Analysis Application?

  • Efficiency: Automates the sentiment analysis process, saving time.
  • Accuracy: Delivers consistent and reliable sentiment ratings.
  • Actionable Insights: Provides clear, data-driven insights for decision-making.
